At the moment we get full change logs so even no precombine works fine : https://github.com/uber/hudi/blob/master/hoodie-hadoop-mr/src/main/java/com/uber/hoodie/hadoop/realtime/RealtimeCompactedRecordReader.java#L104 but this issue still exists.
Moved to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-71

@rahuledavalath How are you running a compaction on a table generated by the HoodieDeltaStreamer ? I'm guessing you are using MERGE_ON_READ storage type. Did you use the `HoodieCompactor` tool to run the compaction ? The HoodieDeltaStreamer at the moment does not support compaction operation so if you performed compaction out of the scope of DeltaStreamer it will lose the checkpoints.

I am using hudi client shell to connect to the hudi data source path(MERGE_ON_READ). Then sheduling and running the compaction using the commands available in the client shell. 

So if we can't use compaction in this way,  what is the alternative for compacting this data set.  (Document support is very much less on the compaction side) Please assist on this.

The Confluent Kafka integration that we have in Hudi requires Schema Registry service (See https://docs.confluent.io/current/schema-registry/docs/schema_registry_tutorial.html)  to be running alongside Kafka when using Kafka as an Avro Source. 

DeltaStreamer is a generic tool in the sense that it can support other types of sources than Avro (JSON, RDD). The configuration you mentioned (hoodie.deltastreamer.schemaprovider.source.schema.file) is used internally in DeltaStreamer to register schemas in Hudi. 

In your case, it is better to use SchemaRegistry service approach instead of FileBasedSchemaProvider  as that can avoid duplicating schema

An example config (kafka-source.properties):

hoodie.deltastreamer.schemaprovider.registry.url=http://localhost:8081/subjects/impressions-value/versions/latest
# Kafka Source
hoodie.deltastreamer.source.kafka.topic=impressions
#Kafka props
metadata.broker.list=localhost:9092
auto.offset.reset=smallest
schema.registry.url=http://localhost:8081

We should be able to run inline compaction... @rahuledavalath I think current defaults are probably not great.. 

@bvaradar please see if this needs a JIRA to make it simpler.

I think the **inline compaction** will trigger when certain conditions were satisfied.   I have found some configurations for the same in **http://hudi.apache.org/configurations.html.** Here it is not mentioned in which file/way we need to pass this to spark job. 

1.  if i need to give below configs, in which file i need to give this configs.
2. for limiting the file size , which config name should i need to use, limitFileSize  or size or both is valid.
3. in which unit the size we need to give.  for example if i need to give 500bytes or 1MB how i can give.

limitFileSize (size = 120MB) 
logFileMaxSize (logFileSize = 1GB) 

Can you please assist on this.

@leilinee :  We have created the jira (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-73) to provide direct support to Avro Kafka Source.  

I am not sure if you already have schema registry setup. Let us know if you run into any issues using Hudi.

@rahuledavalath : Agreed, we will be improving the overall documentation in the near future. 

Thanks for your question in @dev ML. Keep posting questions directly in ML for quicker response.

As mentioned in the Mailing List:
The configuration setup depends on which mechanism you use w.r.t Spark :
1. For Spark DataSource route, you can use the "options" API of DataFrameWriter to pass in these configs. Here is an example from http://hudi.apache.org/incremental_processing.html
inputDF.write()
      .format("com.uber.hoodie")
      .options(clientOpts) // any of the Hudi client opts can be passed in as well
      .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.RECORDKEY_FIELD_OPT_KEY(), "_row_key")
      .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.PARTITIONPATH_FIELD_OPT_KEY(), "partition")
      .option(DataSourceWriteOptions.PRECOMBINE_FIELD_OPT_KEY(), "timestamp")
      .option(HoodieWriteConfig.TABLE_NAME, tableName)
      .mode(SaveMode.Append)
      .save(basePath);
2. For an approach involving using HoodieWriteClient directly, you can simply construct HoodieWriteConfig object with the configs in the link you mentioned.
3. When using HoodieDeltaStreamer tool to ingest, you can set the configs in properties file and pass the file as the cmdline argument "--props"

All the file-size configs must be in bytes denomination

Regarding your general question about making compaction work with DeltaStreamer, enabling inline compaction is the best option (setting hoodie.compact.inline=true). With this enabled, compaction will run after every ingestion. To reduce the frequency, set hoodie.compact.inline.max.delta.commits to a value greater than 1. 

We will enable inline compaction as default for delta-streamer for MOR cases.

INFO HoodieDeltaStreamer: Checkpoint to resume from : Optional[ROW63,0:11]
INFO VerifiableProperties: Verifying properties
WARN VerifiableProperties: Property **OPERATION_OPT_KEY** is not valid
INFO VerifiableProperties: Property auto.offset.reset is overridden to smallest
WARN VerifiableProperties: Property **compactionSmallFileSize** is not valid
WARN VerifiableProperties: Property **hoodie.compact.inline** is not valid

Can you please assist on this.
i use sprak 2.1.1 for netty-all-4.0.42.Final with redisson for netty-all-4.0.41.Final , but i see that has differences for two jar，how i can do it ? rebuild redisson or spark for netty-all？

@rahuledavalath : This warn messages might be misleading in this context. Looks like it it coming from Kafka Source. At very high-level DeltaStreamer uses a single properties object to configure all things and this error could be coming from a component that do not understand other configs. Can you let the delta-streamer run to completion. Are you seeing errors/exception stopping the job ?

@bvaradar There is no errors and exception but i am unable to notice a compaction.  
I doubt the properties  which is mentioned in the configurations section(http://hudi.apache.org/configurations.html)  will not work with deltastreamer class.
Below job i am using for all test cases including compaction.

spark-submit --class com.uber.hoodie.utilities.deltastreamer.**HoodieDeltaStreamer** **hoodie-utilities-0.4.5.jar**--storage-type **MERGE_ON_READ** --source-class com.uber.hoodie.utilities.sources.**JsonKafkaSource**  --source-ordering-field ts  --target-base-path /MOR --target-table MOR **--props /kafka-source.properties**  --schemaprovider-class com.uber.hoodie.utilities.schema.FilebasedSchemaProvider 

(I did't found **hoodie.compact.inline** property in the documentation)

This is an issue only during the write phase, other stages that have higher parallelism (for eg. BloomIndex) don't have issues. So although it may be a spark issue, we need to see why it manifests during the last write stage.

@daikon12 : 

The run_hive_sync tool failed because there were multiple standalone jdbc jars found in your hive installation. We have not seen this case in our installations. I have created a PR (https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/609) to handle this case. Can you please apply this patch, try this out and let us know if this solved the issue.

Thanks,
Balaji.V
